result.markdown:
--- title: "Model" format: html: code-fold: true --- ::: {.cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import duckdb from palmerpenguins import penguins from pandas import get_dummies import numpy as np from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression from sklearn import preprocessing ``` ::: ## Get Data ::: {.cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} con = duckdb.connect('my-db.duckdb') df = penguins.load_penguins() con.register('df',df) con.execute('CREATE TABLE penguins AS SELECT * FROM df') con.close() ``` ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} df = penguins.load_penguins().dropna() df.head(3) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3} ```{=html}
species island bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_length_mm body_mass_g sex year
0 Adelie Torgersen 39.1 18.7 181.0 3750.0 male 2007
1 Adelie Torgersen 39.5 17.4 186.0 3800.0 female 2007
2 Adelie Torgersen 40.3 18.0 195.0 3250.0 female 2007
``` ::: ::: ## Define Model and Fit ::: {.cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} X = get_dummies(df[['bill_length_mm', 'species', 'sex']], drop_first = True) y = df['body_mass_g'] model = LinearRegression().fit(X, y) ``` ::: ## Get some information ::: {.cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} print(f"R^2 {model.score(X,y)}") print(f"Intercept {model.intercept_}") print(f"Columns {X.columns}") print(f"Coefficients {model.coef_}") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` R^2 0.8555368759537614 Intercept 2169.2697209393973 Columns Index(['bill_length_mm', 'species_Chinstrap', 'species_Gentoo', 'sex_male'], dtype='object') Coefficients [ 32.53688677 -298.76553447 1094.86739145 547.36692408] ``` ::: ::: ## turn our model into a Vetiver model and save it to /data/model ::: {.cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} from vetiver import VetiverModel v = VetiverModel(model, model_name='penguin_model', prototype_data=X) ``` ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=7} ``` {.python .cell-code} from vetiver import vetiver_pin_write from vetiver import VetiverAPI import pins ``` ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=8} ``` {.python .cell-code} b = pins.board_folder('data/model', allow_pickle_read=True) vetiver_pin_write(b,v,'penguin_model') v = VetiverModel.from_pin(b, 'penguin_model') ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Model Cards provide a framework for transparent, responsible reporting. Use the vetiver `.qmd` Quarto template as a place to start, with vetiver.model_card() Writing pin: Name: 'penguin_model' Version: 20240305T223621Z-82872 ``` ::: ::: # Generate a {fastAPI} model ::: {.cell execution_count=9} ``` {.python .cell-code} app = VetiverAPI(v,check_prototype = True) ``` ::: # run this to open a python virtual environment: .venv\Scripts\activate
